column4: Anyone know about totem? its just I assume that at some point it has worked for someone, but I've never actually seen it play a file - it always says the plugin isn't available or something
They should support mplayer ;)
its not like totem is eer going to work ;)
ok... install totem-xine => remove ubuntu-desktop, that doesn't seem good
oh ok, fair enough
I dunno what "support" means anyway
thats irritating
I can't see why they stick with totem when it is so very bad, everything else is great apart from video playback
seems easier just to install xine
or gxine
all they do is put it in a repo that is not supported
yeah but what I mean is, why support totem, which is useless, rather than gxine, which does everything?
the repo is not added in the default intall
you add it
it just leads to a load of people getting frustrated that they can't play video
yup I've sorted it out, I just don't understand why totem is supported but not a video player that actually plays videos :) Anyway, doesn't matter, its easy to fix
dude
totem is not supported because it is in a repository that is not supported
totem is installed by default ...
no it isnt
and wont be
and wont
and shall not
oh. So where did I get it from on the live cd?
